info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 1:54PM PDT until August 10 at 3:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTY... At 154 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain has decreased across the warned area. However, between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain has fallen and runoff from the storms will continue. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Spring Mountains, Hilltop Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Lee Canyon Rd and US-93 between Cold Creek Rd and Kyle Canyon Rd. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
